title: What is a bruiser?
body:
Because any time I say anything about (Insert x champion here) I get a load of crap about “they aren’t a bruiser they are a diver,slayer,burster, ass hat, taco maker, minion farmer specialist, or some other convoluted bs to avoid what they are. 

Darius, garen, nasus - juggernauts

Irelia, Kled - divers

Fiora, renekton - duelers

Seriously. They are all just fucking bruisers. Call them what they are. Enough of this bs to attempt to dissuade arguments by saying “they aren’t a bruiser, they are a dog meat taco specialist who identifies as a tanky tank slayer assassin, kiter!”

replies.body: "Bruiser" isn't a categorization utilized by Riot officially, which is why it is hard to find a common agreement on what is, and isn't, a Bruiser.

> [{quoted}](name=Warlord Rhinark,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=a2VIJ6o5,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-03-06T09:02:49.365+0000)

> "Bruiser" isn't a categorization utilized by Riot officially, which is why it is hard to find a common agreement on what is, and isn't, a Bruiser.

Issue being these same people are the ones who say “conquerer should only be taken by bruisers!” Or “bruiser items are so weak” then when you point out they are the literal best items in the game they back pedal about how titanic is a diver item or some stupid shit.

While there are different types, a bruiser is generally a damage dealing champ who can jump into a fight and have some for of tankiness or survivability. Divers are mobile bursters, Juggernauts are tanky sustained-damage dealers, and duelists are mobile sustained-damage dealers.

Learn the differences. Learn the champs.

it's the class that most would-be "strength champs" were pigeon-holed into since the STR/AGI/INT class system was abandoned for a dual class AP/AD system...more or less.

They are the front-line and often initiators of team fights. They can deal damage and take damage. They are mostly all reliant on AD ratios and have relatively good armor/hp ratios to compensate. 

Most of the tank supports are also bruisers. All of the tank top laners are bruisers. All melee top laners that build AD are bruisers... and AFAIK the only ranged bruiser is Jayce.. the only ranged "bruiser" in dota I think is Huskar.

In dota all Strength does is increase auto attack damage for every point of strength they have on top of everything else strength does(mainly just give HP). Same for Agility and Intelligence heroes..

I would say bruisers are a mix of strength and agility, because strength heroes can be hard carries and bruisers often build lots of attack speed(which is main stat agility increases).. but all ADCs would be agility.

> Most of the tank supports are also bruisers. All of the tank top laners are bruisers.

Perhaps in your perspective. Ask anyone else on the boards and they draw a harsh line between tanks and the term “bruisers”.

to be able to answer this question most effectively, you have to be able to look at a champion's kit and successfully answer "why is my champion melee and not ranged?" and vice-versa. after looking over all the champions and asking this question for each of them, you _should_ have a decent understanding of what makes a **bruiser** uniquely _melee_ by nature

I tend to genuinely ask people this, because often times Inhave no clue what they mean. Part of it is when I started, the class was “fighters”, so that’s the term I’ve always used (it’s always felt the easier term to remember and say for me). The other part is The only consistency I usually see between champs called bruisers is melee and damage dealer. At that point, when people start complaining one way or the other, I tend to try to see if it can broken down to more descriptive because..well, that helps me understand better when the discussion is on skirmishers, divers, or juggernauts. Thankfully no one has tried to correct me when I use fighters as the class name.

Although I’ve experienced the opposite of you, where someone, a fighter main, will be talking about how “bruisers” are weak or strong and I’ll bring up a champ and get “oh they aren’t a bruiser.”

I personally try to break down to details to have a clearer understanding of the discussion and what a champ needs, and the subclasses do that for me.

bruiser is just an old term for juggernauts, divers (both fighter subclasses) and skirmishers. 

i mean according to riot skirmishers are grouped in with assassins, but that doesnt really make sense imo. personally id group in skirmishers with the other fighters.

Some classifications are weird.
To be fair, he is a fast boi in midgame.

A true chad doesn't dash.

I was under the impression that Bruiser meant something along the lines of-----a champion that can both deal and soak a proportionally-higher amount of damage than the norm, but lacks any solid means to secure a kill by one's self, hence 'bruising' as opposed to killing lol.

So you fix your post and suddenly now garen isn’t a juggernaut(which riot even labels him as) but he’s a stay at home dad who cooks exclusively with kale or some stupid shit.

It really depends on the champ. Bruisers usually build 1-2 damage items then go tank. Fiora isn’t a bruiser, she’s a melee carry, she builds all ad, maybe one tank item depending on the circumstances, but her role is not to soak up damage while putting out damage. She’s a primary damage dealer who is squishy.

The term "Bruiser" is honestly just a made up term to describe fighter characters like {{champion:24}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:58}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:77}} {{champion:2}}  Generally tanky fighters that deal pretty decent damage but aren't tanky enough to be immune to everything.

Bruisers = Fighters

Fighters have two subclasses: Juggernauts, Divers
